intro: Gentianopsis detonsa subsp. detonsa, commonly known as the Sierra gentian, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers, which typically bloom in late summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves and grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and mountain meadows. It is part of the Gentianaceae family, known for its showy, often blue or purple flowers. The subspecies detonsa is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and floral characteristics.
